tags: I can't deal with all of this
summary: I can't stop thinking about Lucas saying "Et t'es sûre qu'ON "we" previent ses parents" and Lucille responding "Évidement que JE...
body:
I can’t stop thinking about Lucas saying “Et t'es sûre qu’ON "we” previent ses parents" and Lucille responding “Évidement que JE "I” préviens ses parents"

He didn’t question it, of course he’s a part of this, of course he includes himself when asking what to do, of course he wants to go see how Eliott is doing. And then Lucille is keeping him away…

reblog.comment:

tags: some of y’all about to be real mad at me but it must be said
summary: i’m just gonna say it. it’s gonna be real hard for me to forgive lucille in episode 10. it’s gonna take a lot more than “you’re...
body: i’m just gonna say it. it’s gonna be real hard for me to forgive lucille in episode 10. it’s gonna take a lot more than “you’re good for him. he should stay with you. i’m sorry. take it minute by minute” to make me feel okay. she’s hurt lucas way way more than i think sonja hurt isak. the situations are just so different. the abandonment issues seem so much more prominent with lucas and to hear that the one person you’ve finally fallen in love with who loves you /can’t/ love you from the mouth of someone who you perceivably trusted to help in a situation who instead turned manipulative and harmful? i just can’t forgive her for that. for knowingly being so cruel when lucas was obviously upset but was willing to go and be there for eliott. i can’t take an apology from her. i can’t handle her infantilizing eliott and treating him like a toy and minimizing him to his disorder. for thinking that she’s the only one who knows what is best for him. she can’t come back from this. she’s been so so much crueler than sonja ever was.

blog.title: it all leads to better days

tags: sorry i am ... i have Feelings
summary: i have just never seen something like that before, i cannot get over how well maxence played it. like how hectic and complex his...
body:
i have just never seen something like that before, i cannot get over how well maxence played it. like how hectic and complex his mind would have been all reflected through the simplest of facial expressions. we literally saw this massive decline, this sudden shift play out in front of our eyes, from this happy glow to this manic daze slipping into this deep isolation

@ skam france, you need all the awards

blog.name: wanderlust-in-my-soul
blog.title: Catching rays of sunshine
blog.description: Josi | she/her | Multifandom, but mostly Skam and its remakes | a little bit messy | feel free to talk to me or send in some requests for gifs or fics - I am always looking for inspiration!

tags: i am really angry right now
how am i supposed to sleep tonight?
this scene always cracks me up
josi needs to talk about stuff
summary: I don't know what to say. I lost my words somewhere between eliott's speak about the marriage and lucille telling Lucas he means...
body:
I don’t know what to say. I lost my words somewhere between eliott’s speak about the marriage and lucille telling Lucas he means nothing to Eliott.

I mean, I get she’s upset and worried, but…this is really bad shit to tell someone. That is just something you say to hurt somebody.

My heart just broke, shattered on the ground like Lucas’ whole soul. And damn Axel was excellent!

The way he sat on the stairs, crying his heart out. Didn’t know how to handle all these emotions. His biggest fear was that Eliott was just playing with him, that he was just a little game, a little distraction. And boom, lucille confirmed it. Confirmed that eliott couldn’t love him. Why not? Because he’s bipolar? That isn’t a reason to not be able to love someone! That is so wrong! And it makes me so angry! I am angry about people reducing other people on their mental health or their illnesses. Are you loving a person truthfully if you reduce them on their MI and take away their own mind and feelings from them, thinking you know what’s best for them and what they feel and what they think and what they need?

summary: I love how they didn't romanticized it (personally I think the italian one is the best one so far 'cause they showed it in such...
body: I love how they didn’t romanticized it (personally I think the italian one is the best one so far ‘cause they showed it in such a raw way, just like it is in real life). Nowadays is common to see in movie/tv shows romanticized mental illness, giving you this idea of a romantic love that’s gonna fix the person who’s struggling with it. The truth is, people, we don’t need to be fixed because we are not broken. We need to be cured because mental illness are diseases, simply. What you can do is be there, be patience because I know it can be hard to deal with us, hold our hand while we heal.

reblog.comment: I love how they didn’t romanticized it (personally I think the italian one is the best one so far ‘cause they showed it in such a raw way, just like it is in real life). Nowadays is common to see in movie/tv shows romanticized mental illness, giving you this idea of a romantic love that’s gonna fix the person who’s struggling with it. The truth is, people, we don’t need to be fixed because we are not broken. We need to be cured because mental illness are diseases, simply. What you can do is be there, be patience because I know it can be hard to deal with us, hold our hand while we heal.

Nowadays is common to see in movie/tv shows romanticized mental illness, giving you this idea of a romantic love that’s gonna fix the person who’s struggling with it. The truth is, people, we don’t need to be fixed because we are not broken. We need to be cured because mental illness are diseases, simply. What you can do is be there, be patience because I know it can be hard to deal with us, hold our hand while we heal.
trail.content: I love how they didn’t romanticized it (personally I think the italian one is the best one so far ‘cause they showed it in such a raw way, just like it is in real life). Nowadays is common to see in movie/tv shows romanticized mental illness, giving you this idea of a romantic love that’s gonna fix the person who’s struggling with it. The truth is, people, we don’t need to be fixed because we are not broken. We need to be cured because mental illness are diseases, simply. What you can do is be there, be patience because I know it can be hard to deal with us, hold our hand while we heal.

blog.name: littlelooneyluna
blog.title: it all leads to better days

summary:
listen, i have a list:
the way axel captured that slow realisation was so incredible, like the minute you see him realise that...
body:
listen, i have a list:

  • the way axel captured that slow realisation was so incredible, like the minute you see him realise that this is something deeper than being a little high or drunk or anything
  • the way they showed elliot zoning out and speaking continuously without even really speaking at all was so impactful
  • the way maxence completely captured the amazing highs of being young and in love to the devasting lows of feeling so alone and secluded
  • the desperation of lucas as he tries to look for him and feels so hopeless against it
  • the music?? the music just set such an eerie tone, it was beautiful and soft at first and then the tone changed completely and it was so well done
  • THE ACTING FULL STOP QUITE FRANKLY
  • i could go on forever
